result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. George A. Saunders

records.addlTxt:
3:49 PM Prosecuting attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant George A. Saunders in court, in custody.  Attorney Chad A Shamali in court for George A. Saunders. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF890/22CT337.Victim rights compliance. ADA Tombasco updates the Court on the status of this case. Bond motion filed by Attorney Shamali. Arguments heard; State objects to bond motion and requests the cash bond be raised. Court denies bond motion. Court will not raise nor lower bond and bond will remain as previously set. Both parties are requesting an adjournment so they may continue to works towards resolution. Court adjourns.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:32 AM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, George A. Saunders, appeared in custody with Attorney Chad A Shamali.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF890/22CT337.   Victim rights compliance. State is requesting an adjournment for concerns that were just brought to their attention this morning set forth on the record. Attorney Shamali objects to any adjournment. Court will adjourn to allow the State to further investigate.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, George A. Saunders, appeared in custody with Attorney Chad A Shamali.   Clerk N. Nobile.
NO RECORD: 22CF890/22CT337. Matter is resolved. Due to both parties the hearing did not start until after 11:00 am. ADA Tombasco could not appear until 11:34 am as he had to appear by telephone as a special prosecutor for a Racine County Case. Attorney Shamali requests the hearing be rescheduled to later this week if the Court has anytime available.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant George A. Saunders appeared with Attorney Chad A Shamali.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  ST called witness KPD Ofc Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Shamai. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Domestic Abuse Enhancer is stricken from the both counts.  Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information and Amended information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

03:28 PM   Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.   Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Chad Shamali.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am. $2000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). mi
